headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Yugoslavia: Resignations In War-Crimes Dispute

lead_paragraph: Serbia's top two intelligence officials resigned and the civilian police took command of a rebellious secret service unit in a dispute over cooperation with the United Nations war-crimes tribunal. Members of the unit who staged protests and set up roadblocks demanded the resignation of the interior minister and refused to arrest any war crimes suspects until Yugoslavia passes special laws on extradition to the tribunal. A government decree on extradition was declared unconstitutional last week by the Constitutional Court.
abstract: Serbia's top two intelligence officials resign and civilian police take control of rebellious secret service unit in dispute over cooperation with UN war crimes tribunal (S)
